Although interactions between climate and the global dust cycle remain highly uncertain, recent advances now permit an order-of-magnitude estimation of the direct dustâ€“climate feedback. In particular, a physically based dust emission scheme can now reproduce the global dust cycle without the use of an empirical source function
17, 21 . Furthermore, the coupling of the nitrogen and carbon cycles in climate models
22 has enabled nitrogen limitation to more realistically constrain the effects of CO 2 fertilization on desert extent
23 . Finally, recent work has constrained the dust direct radiative effect (DRE) in the present climate
